Blood drips from the Raider’s mouth, even as he laughs at Kane. The GIRL watches from her place on the ground nearby, horrified. Kane shakes the possessed Raider.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: What in God’s name are you?

dialogues.speaker: RAIDER
dialogues.text: I am nothing in that God’s name; I am a servant of the shadows. My master released us from the pit and these human bodies are enough for our needs. Then Kane sees, on the crest of a distant hill, the OVERLORD, watching silently. The bloodied raider before him speaks.

dialogues.speaker: RAIDER
dialogues.text: Do you believe that your salvation lies in saving this single girl?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I will find her.

dialogues.speaker: RAIDER
dialogues.text: You will fail; slayer of innocents, murderer killer of your own brother

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I will hunt you down and send your black heart to your master in Hell.

dialogues.speaker: RAIDER
dialogues.text: I have no heart. Nor do you.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 55 Kane shakes the body, smashes his fist into it beating it relentlessly now.

dialogues.speaker: RAIDER
dialogues.text: My Master sends his greetings from The Pit. He is waiting for you. The Masked Rider on the hill turns away. As he does so, the puppet body of the Raider shakes and twisted by one final hideous convulsion. Blood pours from his mouth, nose and eyes and after a single agonized scre it slumps forwards. And then, little by little, the Raider’s face changes to that of a normal young man. The black blood becomes red once again and he lies still. Kane rises slowly, unsure as to his plan. Then he hears a muffled sob from the girl. He goes over to her and gently helps her to sit up.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: You are safe child. The beast is gone.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: What was that thing? He wraps her in his own cloak

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: It’s just a man again now but there was a demon within him. Are you injured?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: No. (a beat) Thank you for saving me. She climbs unsteadily to her feet. Kane watches, not sure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I’m Solomon Kane; what is your name?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: You should rest now Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: I want to go home.  53 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 56 Kane takes her gently by the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Child, they leave none alive. There will be no home for you to return to. She falls silent and then gently begins to cry. This youn woman is really little more than a girl. Kane is at a los know how to comfort her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE has set a small camp fire going and is cooking up so simple food over the flame. Elizabeth sits nearby with Kane’s cloak around her.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: You risk your life for your love.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: My love?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: This girl, Meredith, that you seek; you must love her very much.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: No. She is... I made a promise. That is all.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: I didn’t mean to intrude. He waves her apology away and sets about preparing the camp.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Tell me what you know of this evil.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: My father....my father said the Raiders were from the west - Cornwall, perhaps, or Devonshire. He said there is a sorcerer raising an army of these Raiders to take over the land. That masked man; he is their general - a demon in a man’s body they say who can control the soldiers with his mind alone. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 54 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 87 ELIZABETH(cont'd) They burn and butcher at will and more are joining them all the time. How can anyone fight this?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: (quietly) I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mist hangs in the air around their tiny camp. The two horses graze placidly nearby. Kane adds a little more wood to the small camp FIRE. ELIZABETH is asleep huddled before the flames. He watches her for a moment, clearly a little conflicted over something. Then, quietly, he GATHERS HIS WEAPONS, checks them, and straps them to his horse. He takes all the food, clothing and other useful items an leaves them by the fire, next to the girl. He takes a PISTOL and POWDER and rests those near to her too. After another moment of silent thought he walks back to h horse and mounts. The noise wakes ELIZABETH.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I’ve left you all the provisions I have. Do you know how to use a pistol? She scrambles to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Why? You’re leaving me? No!

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Elizabeth, you cannot come where I am going. There’s danger ahead and.... When you have rested, take that horse and head east. Find a church. Beg sanctuary.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Please don’t leave me. Please. I have nothing left. Please... Kane is torn between duties but he has no choice.  55 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 58

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I am sorry, Elizabeth. I have to go. May God protect you. He drives his heels into his horse and gallops away into the mist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RAIDERS and their WAGON TRAIN have come to a halt outside a small village on the edge of a dark forest It is just one of several wagons joining together to form longer train. A rough platoon of Raiders walks or rides alongside. It may be an army of sorts but it is crude and undisciplined. We see now that there are DIFFERENT CASTES OF RAIDERS; so are little more than rough looking men whilst others, clearly of higher rank, are far more corrupted and change Seemingly the longer they have been fighting, the more strongly the possession takes hold. MEREDITH is lying on her side at the bottom of a CAGE mounted on the back of a wagon. She is freezing cold, shivering and filthy. There is a DEAD BODY right beside her in the overpacked wagon. She is praying quietly, intensely.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Heavenly Father, I beseech you to save us from this evil. (to a companion) Pray with me. Pray for us all.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTIVE
dialogues.text: Slavery or sacrifice; there is nothing else for us.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Don’t give up. We will find the strength to survive this. In the name of the Father, Son and the Holy Ghost... One of the RAIDERS walking near Meredith’s wagon, slams t flat of his sword against the cage.

dialogues.speaker: RAIDER
dialogues.text: Quiet! (to his companions) Clear out the dead!  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 59 MEREDITH shrinks back from the front of the cage as the savage raiders fling open the door and DRAG OUT THE BODIE They are DUMPED by the side of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOZEN MEN OF THE VILLAGE are lined up on their knees before the OVERLORD. RAIDERS are gathered around. Other VILLAGERS are watching from a huddled group nearby. They have the grim resolution of a beaten community as th Raiders take food and water as they please. On GIBBETS by the side of the road a DOZEN MEN ARE HANGIN BY THEIR NECKS.

dialogues.speaker: VILLAGER
dialogues.text: Don’t join them! Don’t do it!

dialogues.speaker: YOUTH
dialogues.text: Father! Don’t! One of the MEN on his knees in the line turns to the crow

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: What choice is there? We must join them or perish. The OVERLORD stands before this man. Two Raiders at his shoulder speak for him in strange synchronization.

dialogues.speaker: RAIDERS/OVERLORD
dialogues.text: Will you serve the Master?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Y...yes. The Overlord takes hold of the villager’s head between hi huge hands. The man SCREAMS for a moment but then begins change... ... rippling from the Overlord’s fingers are creeping tendrils that distort and alter his skin like a FOUL DISEASE overwhelming the human side of him. When the transformation is complete he has the same vacant corrupted look as the other Raiders.

dialogues.speaker: RAIDER/OVERLORD
dialogues.text: Brand him. And these others. Another Raider draws a burning brand from a nearby fire a presses into the new Raider’s flesh. He seems to barely even notice.  56 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 60 A YOUNG MAN - no more than 15 - charges towards the Overlord. He has a short sword raised, ready to strike th Overlord.

dialogues.speaker: YOUTH
dialogues.text: Father!!! With stunning speed the Overlord draws his massive broadsword. In one sweeping motion he SLICES THE BOY in half. The BOY’S FATHER looks down at the body with no emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE rides along what passes for a road but is little mor than a muddy track. He’s bundled up against the cold; clo wrapped tightly around. He slows a little when HE COMES TO A CROSSROADS and check his direction on a COMPASS. The needle spins crazily, no matter how he holds it. Ahead of him he sees PEOPLE coming down the road. A CROWD OF RAGGED REFUGEES fleeing whatever evil is beyond. They are hollowed eyed and road weary and not all peasants. So are clad in finer clothes but all are escaping the terror

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Greetings friends. No one speaks. They just hurry past him. Kane drops from his horse and approaches a MAN and his FAMILY. He takes the locket from his neck, opens it and shows the picture to the refugees.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: This girl; have you seen her? You? Any of you? They don’t care. Won’t look. Others just flow by. Kane tries to show them all but no one cares.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Stop damn you! Look at it. Look!

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: If she was taken there is no hope.  57 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 61

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I am hunting those who did this to you. I need to know where they are!

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: They are everywhere. Ghouls creatures and demons are abroad. Every foul thing of the earth has come. No one can fight them.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Pray for your friend; it is all you can do now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a shallow FORD that bisects the road. KANE dismounts and leads his horse over to it. He allows it to drink before scooping up a few handfuls of water himself and refilling his water bottles. Then he sees a PILE OF ROTTING BODIES dumped at the side the road. Some of the corpses have spilled into the water Kane spits out the water and empties his bottles again.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: (pulling the horse away) Stop. Don’t drink; it’s befouled. Can you not taste it animal? As he pulls the reluctant horse away he notices there are SEVERAL PEASANTS standing silent and ghostlike in the hedges and undergrowth nearby.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I’m looking for this girl... There is something wrong with these people. It seems as though their humanity has been stripped away revealing something feral and terrifying beneath. Little by little they begin advancing on him with silent menace. Some have pitchforks, others have axes and others have nothing more than their clawed hands. KANE DRAWS HIS SWORD and spins to try and keep track of them all.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Stay back! His horse bucks and pulls against the reins as Kane struggles to get into a position to remount.  58 59 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 62

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Steady... woah... But the HORSE BREAKS FREE of him, knocking him over, and, in a panic the animal runs away, TRAMPLING OVER a pair of the advancing PEASANTS. Kane, scrambles to his feet and with nothing but his sing SWORD and a PISTOL in his belt, readies himself against t ATTACKERS as they silently close the circle now... The first of the PEASANTS let’s loose a terrible scream a CHARGES AT HIM. Kane is ready... Dropping to his knees he sweeps his blade across his attacker’s legs, SEVERING THEM AT THE KNEE. The victim makes no sound and shows no pain. He simply drops to the floor and even with hideous injuries, continues to strugg on. Kane then turns on the others and, with brutal efficiency sets about their destruction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the light of burning brands the RAIDER’S WAGONS crawl relentlessly across the countryside towards some unknown destination. The CAPTIVES are huddled together. Dead and dying along with the silent, terrified living.

dialogues.speaker: RAIDER
dialogues.text: Clear out the bodies! The wasted bodies of the fallen are roughly dragged out o the wagons and dumped carelessly at the side of the road. MEREDITH is amongst the dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE walks now. He is bloodied and weary and has lost virtually everything but for his sword, his pistol and th clothes on his back and yet still he strides on relentlessly. Determination written in every line of his face.  60 61 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 63 Up ahead, on the crest of a hill he sees a BEACON lightin the tower of a BROKEN DOWN CHURCH, offering sanctuary for the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only noise in this still and misty night is the rattl of the carts and breathing of the horses as they fade awa into the night.

dialogues.speaker: ON A PILE OF CORPSES
dialogues.text: Just a mound of tattered flesh and corpses with MEREDITH lying amongst them. CLOSING IN ON HER FACE... Serene and still. But then... HER EYES SNAP OPEN. Barely daring to breathe she looks around. Desperately nervous she looks around for danger. It seems she is alone but for the dead. Initially tentative and full of fear she begins to scrabb out from the corpse midden. The more she struggles, the more revolted and desperate she becomes... ...Until finally she’s screaming as she tears and pulls a the bodies to get herself free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE passes through the WOODEN ARCHED ENTRANCE of the church yard. The light of the beacon, still flickers in t crumbling bell tower of the ancient Saxon church. An ECHOING SCREAM carries across the dark countryside something evil in the distance. Kane hurries towards the church. GRAVESTONES have been flattened or shattered. There are a COUPLE OF BODIES hanging from a tree in the distance. Thi place has a real sense of death and decay. Strange noises echo across the countryside. He cautiously approaches the door and pushes it open.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 62 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 64

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kane’s feet crunch loudly on the broken masonry that litters the floor. The roof has collapsed in places, exposing the night sky. Pews are scattered and broken, even the altar is overturned. Startled BIRDS, disturbed in their nighttime roost, suddenly explode out of the rafters. SOMETHING IS WATCHING KANE as he explores this desecrated sanctuary. As Kane approaches the altar, and THE WATCHER COMES NEARE stalking him from the shadows... Kane bends to his knees and bows his head before the fall idol. The ATTACKER makes its final approach, a wooden club raised, ready to bring down on Kane. But KANE WHIRLS ROUND AT THE LAST MOMENT and points his pistol right into the face of... a PRIEST. The two are frozen for a moment. This priest is wild-eyed and at the end of his strength. Even if he did strike Kan it would barely register Kane slowly lowers his pistol. He raises empty hands.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: You are in no danger from me Father. The Priest quivers in fear, the cudgel still ready.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I wished only for a little refuge and a moment for prayer. Slowly, the Priest lowers his own weapon.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: F..f..forgive me. I have seen such things.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 63 64 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 6s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the light of the full moon, MEREDITH runs headlong through the night. She stumbles and falls, tripping down a precipitous slope and splashing into A NARROW RIVER... She forces her way across to the other side. But now exhaustion is catching her and as she struggles up the other side she slides back down the mud bank and into the waters. Her freezing fingers claw their way up the muddy banks again but she can hardly make any progress, she’s so tire and cold... But A HAND REACHES FROM THE DARKNESS AND GRABS HERS. A TEENAGE BOY, THOMAS WOOLMAN, is helping her over the to To Meredith, in her dazed and exhausted state, he looks just like SAMUEL.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Samuel? Am I dead?

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: You ain’t dead miss. But we may be if we wait around here much longer. There’s terrible things in the dark. THOMAS helps Meredith to her feet. She can hardly stand b he puts his arms around her and holds her steady.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Do you know a place I can shelter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kane and the Priest - FATHER MICHAEL, a gaunt, wild haire man, clearly hovering on the brink of sanity and still cl in a torn tunic with stained dog-collar - are eating simp fare around a fire that burns in the corner of the church

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Have you come far?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Aye. Two days’ hard ride brought me here but where here is, I do not know.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 66

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MICHAEL
dialogues.text: The borderlands of Somerset and Devonshire.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: (quietly) My homeland.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MICHAEL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I lived in Axmouth Castle as a boy. It’s not so far from here.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MICHAEL
dialogues.text: A sad homecoming for you.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: What happened here? Did the raiders come?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Every foul thing that the light of Christ kept at bay is returning. We have burned so many witches and their familiars but still they keep coming. One of them cursed my flock with her evil, turning them into terrible ghoulish creatures.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I met some on the road before. Flesh and blood but no longer human.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Did you hurt them?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I had no choice.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MICHAEL
dialogues.text: They are innocent of their crimes. I have watched men become monsters before my eyes. They slaughter each other; fathers killing their children, brother murdering brother. Such a hunger is in them. This is truly the end of days.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Do you believe that?  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 67

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MICHAEL
dialogues.text: I believe that God is testing my faith.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: By cursing us all? Christ and all his Angels are asleep whilst we suffer.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Mind your blasphemy! It’s as God wants it. He wants to feel our love for him even through our agony. Kane gets to his feet and paces angrily.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Feel our love?! How can it be right that this evil is walking amongst us, pouring its poison into the land, when all we have to protect us is...what? Faith? Where are the warriors who will take the fight to them? why don’t they walk amongst us just as the foul creatures do? Tell me, Priest; who in the world can fight this Evil? Kane is caught in a shaft of moonlight which splinters through the broken roof. Sword in hand, pistol in his bel and anger written across his face... ...the answer to Kane’s own question is obvious to the priest, even if it not to Kane himself. Kane hears a movement and is suddenly alert.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: There is something out there.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MICHAEL
dialogues.text: No son, there is nothing evil out there. Kane prepares himself for a fight

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MICHAEL
dialogues.text: The evil is here already. Kane turns to him, confused by this.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 68 The Priest limps over to a trap door in the floor of the church. He reaches to the handle and lifts it. Kane picks up a burning brand and approaches.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MICHAEL
dialogues.text: See... For a moment Kane stares into the BLACKNESS BELOW and see nothing and SUDDENLY a DOZEN PALE FACES appear, luminous evil eyes, snarling and grasping for him but they can’t g out of the cellar.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: My God... Father Michael giggles a little. It’s an uneasy, slightly insane laugh.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MICHAEL
dialogues.text: What was I to do? They were men and women once; People I knew.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Destroy them, man!

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MICHAEL
dialogues.text: I cannot destroy them; I am their shepherd. This is my test of faith; to love even the foulest creatures. The CREATURES in the cellar are silent but watch Kane wit terrible menace and hunger. They have sharp, bloody teeth their hair is thinning and falling out in clumps, their skin white and waxen.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Not any more. They are changed... they are creatures of darkness now. I have seen the like before in my travels. Vampires or undead ghouls of some form...You cannot...

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MICHAEL
dialogues.text: No! They are my flock and I have a duty of care towards them. I... keep them. I... care for them. I... feed them. Kane is horrified.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Feed them? What do they eat? THE PRIEST SUDDENLY RUSHES AT KANE and SHOVES HIM BACKWAR towards the OPEN TRAP DOOR.  65 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 69

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Flesh. Kane, taken by surprise, stumbles and teeters on the edge of the open hatchway... and it seems that he might just keep his footing until... ...with a bloodcurdling cry, one of the ghouls leaps up a grabs his leg, yanking him backwards. Kane TUMBLES BACK DOWN INTO THE PIT. The Priest dashes forward and slams the cellar door close on the snarling, screeching pack of ghouls.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER MICHAEL
dialogues.text: May God have mercy on your soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS soon as KANE TUMBLES INTO THE DARK, the GHOULS attack him. Their mouths open baring razor edged teeth. The BURNING TORCH has fallen into the pit with him, its flickering light illuminating the dark space. Kane cries in anger and pain as he beats off his attacker they are feral but weak. He grabs the burning brand and springs to his feet, trying to gauge his position. There are A DOZEN GHOULS all regrouping, ready to attack again. Kane draws his PISTOL and shoots one in the face. It flie back into the others. He hasn’t time to reload again as they attack... He draws his short sword and begins to hack at them. Weig of numbers and slashing claws force him back and they see to feel no pain and have no care for their own safety but their blood lust is immense. As one falls, the others beg to tear at it too. But Kane is pressed back against the crypt walls, fightin for his life now. One leaps right onto him trying to reac his throat, shoving him back hard... ...and some of the MASONRY GIVES WAY BEHIND HIM. The dust brickwork collapses backwards into an open space beyond. There’s a TUNNEL which stretches away to unfathomable darkness.  66 67 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 70 Kane knows what he has to do now; Alternately slicing at the ghouls and trying to break open the tunnel entrance. He shoves the torch at one of the creatures and sets its ragged clothing alight. It screams around the room igniti the others it touches. This gives Kane just enough time to tumble through the small opening and into the dusty and narrow passageway beyond. He turns and runs as fast as he can into the distance, hi torchlight quickly being swallowed in the gloom. The surviving GHOULS scramble through the opening after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PRIEST listens, nervously, to the screams and cries coming from the floor beneath him. He seems satisfied tha his task is done. But then a SHADOW FALLS ACROSS HIM. He turns slowly and SCREAMS...asS a blade flashes through the air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The small side door to a BARN is pushed quietly open as t young shepherd boy THOMAS WOOLMAN enters, quickly followe by MEREDITH. She is shaking with cold and exhaustion.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: You’11 be warm in here.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Thank you. God bless you. Meredith finds a bale of hay and settles into it. Thomas lights an oil lamp and comes near to her. He takes his heavy wool coat and puts it around her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Where were you going?

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Anywhere. Nowhere. I escaped from men who’d captured me. Servants of some terrible evil. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 68 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 72 MEREDITH(cont'd) They killed...They killed...oh Lord...my family. For the first time the true impact of Meredith’s loss see to overwhelm her. She breaks down into tears.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Those raiders they came to this village too. They spared the families of those men who joined them. Others they simply murdered or took away. My sister was taken and many others.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: I am so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: She did not escape them but you did. None have done that before and survived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ragged, bloody and exhausted KANE is hiding in a dark alcove within the tunnels. He’s trying to mask his torch flame and listen to the oncoming SNARLS and FOOTFALLS of the GHOULS. They’re coming ever nearer. Soon they will corner him in his hiding space and so he takes a breath and RUNS OUT in the open CORRIDOR. They see him and immediately charge after him. The burnin torch hardly throws enough light for him to see where he might be heading. He makes random, careless turns down junctions, totally losing himself in the labyrinth. The walls of the tunnels are lined with crypts, coffins a piles of bones. All ancient and dusty. But there is still no way out and he can HEAR THE CREATUR hunting him. A sudden gust of air makes Kane’s brand flicker and he knows which way to go now. He steps out into another corridor and... ...RIGHT INTO A GHOUL that has been stalking him. Kane turns and manages to skewer it onto his sword and race away .  69 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 72 Ahead of him he sees a shaft of silver moonlight breaking through the exit to the chamber. TwO MORE GHOULS suddenly leap down in front of him but he doesn’t break pace he simply CHARGES RIGHT AT THEM. Shouldering one out of the way and carrying the other wit him some distance... his sword having passed through it. He flings the body to one side and scrabbles through the overgrown exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE flops down onto the wet grass and scrambles away. Al his attention focused on the exit... but nothing is following him. Exhausted he lies back and takes a moment to catch his breath. ...@ HUMAN HEAD suddenly lands on the ground right beside him. It is the PRIEST’S HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE 0/S
dialogues.text: Friend of yours? Kane turns suddenly to find himself facing FIVE RAIDERS o horseback. He rises to his feet and faces them without fear. Kane recognizes three of the RAIDERS. They are THE THIEVE WHO ATTACKED him in the woods days earlier but now they a clad in the livery of the raiders. The insignia on their clothes, their manner and weapons different from before. The Great Bearded attacker suddenly seems to recognize wh Kane is. He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: BEARD
dialogues.text: Remember this one lads? He’s not a fighter, remember? BEARD swings down off his horse. SKINHEAD and TATTOO drop down too. They approach Kane, slowly, clearly looking forward to toying with him again. The other two Raiders more corrupted and savage looking than the three, remain horseback.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: So you have pledged your allegiance to this sorcerer?  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 73

dialogues.speaker: BEARD
dialogues.text: We want to be on the winning side, see. Malachi will hold all this land soon enough.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Is that his name; Malachi?

dialogues.speaker: BEARD
dialogues.text: They say he’s the most powerful warlock that’s ever been. But I wouldn’t know about that.

dialogues.speaker: SKINHEAD
dialogues.text: What you doing here Puritan? Only thing round here is fighting.

dialogues.speaker: TATTOO
dialogues.text: And you don’t do that do you? A beat. A smile flickers across Kane’s bloodied face.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Well, you know, I changed my mind about that.

dialogues.speaker: BEARD
dialogues.text: What? Then, swift as some great predatory beast KANE LEAPS FORWARD, swords flashing. He DECAPITATES TATTOO with one swift stroke and in a blur of motion drives his blade int the belly of SKINHEAD. BEARD just about manages to avoid Kane’s returning slicin stroke of his blade. Fast and brutal he attacks Kane. The other Raiders drop from their horses and press in on him too. Bathed in the silvery moonlight and amongst the hanging mist of the cemetery they fight, though there is never an doubt as to the outcome... Kane slices the leg tendons of Beard who drops to the ground, screaming then he turns on the remaining two raiders. ONE IS ALREADY RUNNING FOR HIS HORSE, he leaps on and Manages to escape but the other is too slow. Kane snatche up a sword from the ground and hurls it after the running man. It catches him awkwardly across the neck, severing h jugular. Victorious, Kane stands for a moment, listening to the whimpering cries of the dying and the thunder of horses hooves disappearing into the night.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 74 He turns his attention to BEARD who is trying to crawl aw on useless legs. He has crawled near the entrance to the underground tunnels. Kane grabs Beard and pulls him even NEARER to the tunnel entrance. Clawed hands reach out to grab him. Beard screams in fear.

dialogues.speaker: BEARD
dialogues.text: What are they! !?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: They are your brothers. Kane he takes the locket from around his neck and shows Beard the picture of Meredith.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: This girl; your kind took her.

dialogues.speaker: BEARD
dialogues.text: I don’t know her.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: This is your only chance to live out this night, so look carefully. He pushes Beard back a little nearer. Several of the creatures take hold of him and try to yank him backwards. Their excited snarling fills the air. Kane sees their eye shining in the dark tunnels.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Have you seen her?!

dialogues.speaker: BEARD
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes, I saw her.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Where they’re taking her?

dialogues.speaker: BEARD
dialogues.text: She’s going nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Talk in riddles and I’11 cut your tongue from your head!

dialogues.speaker: BEARD
dialogues.text: She’s dead! She’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: What? Liar!  70 71 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 75

dialogues.speaker: BEARD
dialogues.text: No; I want to live! I wouldn’t lie. She’s dead. I saw her body dragged from the wagon. I was there.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: No! No! NO! This cannot be. She cannot be dead.

dialogues.speaker: BEARD
dialogues.text: She is. Now, I told you what you want! Let me go! Kane releases Beard from his grips. Instantly he is grabb by the ghouls and dragged back into the catacombs. Kane simply walks away as Beard’s agonized screams echo across the cemetery as he is eaten alive. Kane seems oblivious to this as he slowly collapses to th ground against a headstone with an elaborately carved ANG OF DEATH perched upon it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rising through the mist shrouded countryside are the WALL OF A SMALL MARKET TOWN. A FIGURE ON HORSEBACK emerges through the mist and heads slowly towards the gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are dozens of stall holders trying to scrape a ragg living in the SMALL MARKET SQUARE. It is filthy, wet and raining but still bustling with bedraggled customers. Amongst them are RAIDERS grouped together drinking and shouting. It seems this town has already fallen into thei thrall. The insignia of the sorcerer, Malachi, the same that all these Raiders and their followers wear, flies on pendant over the town. A few of the LOCALS move hurriedly aside as a DARKLY DRESSED RIDER leads THREE HORSES through the town gates a into the market square. He ignores the sideways glances a nervous chatter of those he passes. Doesn’t care that a few Raiders watch him. KANE leads the horses through the market to a STABLE nearby.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 76

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE dismounts and leads the horses past a BLACKSMITH and towards the entrance of the stable. The STABLE MASTER com out to greet Kane.

dialogues.speaker: STABLE MASTER
dialogues.text: Good day to you. You’d like to stable your horses?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I want to sell them. The Stable Master notes the Raider’s insignia on their ta and saddles. He’s suddenly a little more suspicious and frightened.

dialogues.speaker: STABLE MASTER
dialogues.text: How did you come by these animals?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: What does it matter?

dialogues.speaker: STABLE MASTER
dialogues.text: They carry the mark of Malachi. If you stole them...

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: You cannot steal from dead men. The Stable Master now notices KANE’S BLOODY WEAPONS and clothing, suddenly he’s VERY nervous. Looks around the to square to see if anyone is watching them.

dialogues.speaker: STABLE MASTER
dialogues.text: Did you kill them? Kane is silent.

dialogues.speaker: STABLE MASTER
dialogues.text: We heard of a man who has been hunting them. You fought them and won.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I won nothing. The Stable Master becomes suddenly conspiratorial. He tak Kane to one side.

dialogues.speaker: STABLE MASTER
dialogues.text: You must hide Sir. This town is theirs; all around here they hold sway. Everywhere. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 73 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 7 STABLE MASTER(cont'd) And spies work for them, listening in shadows betraying any who would fight back. If they know you are here...

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: (too loudly) I don’t care who knows.

dialogues.speaker: STABLE MASTER
dialogues.text: But there are also others here who would fight. They are just waiting for enough men...

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Then let them fight. Pay me.

dialogues.speaker: STABLE MASTER
dialogues.text: Would you not join them?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: No. Now pay me - enough to drink myself into oblivion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEREDITH, hidden under a bed of straw, opens her eyes to the SOUND OF THE BARN DOOR OPENING and VOICES. She is completely hidden amongst the straw.

dialogues.speaker: JONAH 0/S
dialogues.text: Is she in here?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS 0/S
dialogues.text: Why do we need to do this Father? Through strands of straw Meredith watches THOMAS and his father, JONAH, a strong looking middle aged man with a heavy beard walking alongside. He is clearly angry; he grabs his son roughly.

dialogues.speaker: JONAH
dialogues.text: Because if they find we’ve been sheltering her there’1l...they’11 burn us out... or worse.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: She lost her family.

dialogues.speaker: JONAH
dialogues.text: So did we! And I will not lose anything more to save some stranger. Now find her. Meredith shrinks back into the hay as...  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 78 Reluctantly Thomas makes his way towards THE HAYSTACK.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Meredith. It’s Thomas - come on out. He pauses for a moment then, on the urging of his father he pulls away the hay... ...but Meredith is not there. Suddenly a different haystack, right in front of Jonah, erupts as MEREDITH BURSTS OUT and DASHES FOR A HANGING PITCHFORK nearby. She snatches it from the hanger and whirls on Jonah and Thomas, holding them at bay.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: You betrayed me!

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I am sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JONAH
dialogues.text: See now, girl... Meredith backtracks towards a small side door

dialogues.speaker: JONAH
dialogues.text: Listen girl they’re everywhere now. Those who deny them will be killed; we have to show our loyalty.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: And sacrifice me?!

dialogues.speaker: JONAH
dialogues.text: Yes. Jonah suddenly lunges for her. MEREDITH DRIVES THE PITCHFORK INTO JONAH. It skewers him through the arm and shoulder. He falls backwards, screaming in rage and pain. Meredith tears open the BARN DOOR... ...And SCREAMS because... ...the OVERLORD IS STANDING SILHOUETTED IN THE DOORWAY. H massive bulk fills the frame. A cohort of his Raider behi him. Instinctively Meredith drives her pitchfork into him. The sharp prongs penetrate his leather armour and go deep int his chest.  74 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 79 Fatal for any other man, but the Overlord hardly seems to notice. He yanks the pitchfork from his flesh and grabs her. Two Raider’s speak for the Overlord.

dialogues.speaker: RAIDERS/OVERLORD
dialogues.text: My Master has a special punishment for you. He has need of your lifeblood. Meredith fights against his enormous strength, tearing at his mask. A section comes free, exposing a staring, lidle eye and torn, rotting flesh. The Overlord smashes his fist down onto her. Meredith’s world goes black...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An INNKEEPER makes his way through his CROWDED ALE-HOUSE a TABLE IN A DARK CORNER. A motley bunch are drinking themselves into a stinking stupor on his ale. Mostly loca PEASANTS but there are a HANDFUL OF RAIDERS in here too. The innkeeper refills a tankard on the table from the gallon flagon he’s carrying then withdraws. A HAND shoots out of the shadows and grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Leave it all. A bag of coins is tossed onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD
dialogues.text: As you wish. The Landlord leaves the flagon of ale and scoops up the money. He withdraws quickly. Kane drains his tankard, then refills it swiftly. He’s clearly been there a while and is heading for the drunken oblivion he craves. The locket with MEREDITH’S PICTURE is in his hand. The rest of the place is loud and busy but Kane simply ignores it. He enjoys the gloomy darkness of his corner. TwO MEN - GARRICK and TELFORD - push through the crowd towards him. They stop and peer at this drunken man.

dialogues.speaker: GARRICK
dialogues.text: Are you certain?  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 80

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: (looking closely) It’s him. I knew it. Kane hardly notices them as they slide in opposite him. Telford is in his early 20’s, Garrick a little older. Bot are grubby, weary and carelessly dressed but not aggressive. They seem nervous, scanning the room for eavesdroppers. Neither wants to draw attention to himself They lean in to Kane who finally looks up.

dialogues.speaker: GARRICK
dialogues.text: Sir? He ignores the newcomers.

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: Captain Kane? Don’t you remember me? (Kane still ignores them) I was a mate on the Queen’s Ship Fleetway that you captained. Kane peers at him, drunkenly.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Never seen you before.

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: We fought in Africa, against the tribes in the cliff caves. Don’t you remember? Garrick pulls Telford to one side.

dialogues.speaker: GARRICK
dialogues.text: It is not him.

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: It is. It’s Kane. I’1l never forget him. This is the man who can lead us, believe me.

dialogues.speaker: GARRICK
dialogues.text: Where can he lead us? To another tavern? Look at him. Garrick turns back to Kane, still unconvinced.

dialogues.speaker: GARRICK
dialogues.text: (quietly) Hey; drunkard. My friend here says you are the greatest warrior he ever saw. I don’t believe him.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett aL

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I told you, I don’t want...

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: A cohort of Malachi’s raiders rode out at dawn; they were hunting a man who has been harrying them for these past days. Was it you? Kane looks up, slightly.

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: (urgently and a little loud) There are those of us here who would rally to you Captain Kane.

dialogues.speaker: GARRICK
dialogues.text: (to Telford) Keep your voice down; there are others who would betray us.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: What do you mean, ‘a man like me’? A failure?

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: No; you’re a brave man, a warrior. I know what you can do Captain, I have seen it. Kane suddenly grabs Telford across the table and yanks hi close.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: You don’t know what you’re talking about. I am nothing.

dialogues.speaker: GARRICK
dialogues.text: He’s no use. Leave him to his drink.

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: No! Captain Kane, we need a leader. We have to fight back It is clear that people have overheard them now.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Then fight! Kane stumbles to his feet. He falls a little but rights himself.

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: Kane...  75 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 82

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I swore to find her and I failed. My life is over. And with that, Kane staggers into a GROUP OF DRINKERS who shove him away aggressively and he topples over overturning a table and falls, unconscious to the floor The LANDLORD looks down on Kane. He notices that some of the Raiders nearby are taking an interest. The LANDLORD covers this quickly.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD
dialogues.text: This drunkard has had enough; take him to his bed lads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE sleeps in his clothes on a rough straw mattress. His few possessions are piled carelessly near his bed. There are a handful of OTHER DRUNKS sleeping off their booze. Slowly, the DOOR to the BUNKHOUSE creaks open. Six dark, SHADOWY FIGURES waiting in the darkness. Hushed whispers, inaudible instructions but then one voice a little cleare

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: There. Kane is over there. He’s the one I saw. FIVE FIGURES stalk across the room. A sleeping DRUNK wakes...

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK
dialogues.text: What are you...? HIS THROAT IS CUT. The FIGURES SURROUND KANE’S BED, swords in hand, ROPES an SHACKLES in others. They position themselves carefully. One stumbles, makes a noise... KANE, alerted, rouses from his slumber but is too slow... He fumbles for his sword only to have it kicked away. The ATTACKERS GRAB HIM...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 76 77 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 83

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEREDITH now bloodied and beaten, is once again a prisone in a cage. Others are crammed in as before but now she is tied to the bars by heavy ropes and unable to move. She slumps against her bonds, hardly registering the troughs and pot-holes the wagon hits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: GARRICK’S FACE - SCREAMING in agony. With every BLOW OF THE HAMMER he cries louder. His HANDS are being NAILED TO A WOODEN CROSS by a RAIDER. The STABLE KEEPER is nearby him, unconscious and bloody - already pinned to the wood. OTHERS too are lined up; anyo who might have been involved with them is being crucified in the town square. TELFORD is not there though. A PARTY of RAIDERS and LOCALS are raising the crosses. Th market square has been trashed, any stalls that were left have been shattered, others are burning. The silent OVERLORD watches from his horse as the first o the crosses are raised. The cries of pain are unbearable. The TOWN LOCALS have been herded into a group. Raiders wi their weapons ready face them but no one is going to figh A POSSESSED RAIDER speaks with his MASTER’S VOICE. It echoes unnaturally across the town square.

dialogues.speaker: RAIDER/OVERLORD
dialogues.text: (talking to the townspeople) This is the fate of those who would defy us. These traitors in your midst have brought about your destruction. There will be no mercy. The OVERLORD turns to see... ...KANE BEING DRAGGED OUT OF A NEARBY BUILDING by his CAPTORS. He is not struggling, seemingly resigned to his fate. The Raiders haul Kane across the square, literally draggi him over the stones and casting him to the ground before the Overlord who regards him from behind his expressionle mask. He drops from his horse and approaches Kane.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 84

dialogues.speaker: RAIDER
dialogues.text: This is the one Master, the one who hunts us. The rebels want him as their leader. The Overlord leans down to Kane, reaches out with a glove hand and raises his face to his own. The Overlord’s eyes stare keenly from the mask. He is so close to Kane now th he can whisper IN HIS OWN VOICE. It is a frail, rasping whisper. He is almost tender as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: Can you hear me Solomon? Kane stares up at the monster before him.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: Do you know me?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I know you for the foul servant of evil you are.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: He cannot be defeated - even by you. Join us.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I am going to kill you all.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: You cannot kill one who is already dead. Goodbye brother. The Overlord stands suddenly and turns and strides away from Kane any hint of humanity or connection is lost

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Brother?! What do you mean? What do you know of my brother?! The Overlord ignores him and once more he speaks through his minions.

dialogues.speaker: RAIDER/OVERLORD
dialogues.text: (to the crowd) This man cannot save you from us. He is nothing! Crucify him. Burn this town to ashes. Amidst the screams of protest and fear of the townspeople the Overlord climbs onto his horse and thunders away, taking many of his warriors with him.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 78 79 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 8s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OVERLORD leads his men away. As they pass the gated entrance a GROUP OF SLAVE CAGE WAGONS that have been waiting outside the town are whipped into action. MEREDITH IS IN ONE OF THE CAGES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the light of a blood-red dawn KANE is taken and shoved forward through the crowds. The Raiders kick and punch him. Some of the crowd are silent whilst others are shouting and jeering.

dialogues.speaker: ONLOOKER
dialogues.text: He brought this on us! It is his fault! In the background PEOPLE are SCREAMING as soldiers set FI to the houses. KANE ignores it all. He has already given up; there is nothing more he can do now. They TIE A ROPE AROUND HIS CHEST, holding him to the cros and stretch his arms onto the beams. Then the long iron nails are laid against his palms and POUNDED THROUGH THE FLESH. He grits his teeth against the agony but makes no sound.

dialogues.speaker: RAIDER
dialogues.text: (to his companion) He’s tough. They always scream.

dialogues.speaker: COMPANION
dialogues.text: Did you see the Master? He fears this man above all others.

dialogues.speaker: RAIDER
dialogues.text: Best make sure he suffers then. The pair continue to SMASH THE NAILS into Kane’s body. Wi each brutal HAMMER BLOW the SCREAMS Kane can hear all around him finally begin to fade. The leering, laughing faces of the Raiders, their punches and blows mean nothin any more. He is dying... His vision flickers to BLACK for a moment... He regains consciousness again as HIS CROSS IS RAISED TO VERTICAL... His body sags down against the ropes holding him to the main vertical beam. His arms pull against the nails through his palms. Blood runs down his arms.  80 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett a6 But when he opens his eyes and looks down THE WORLD HAS CHANGED... HE IS IN HELL. It is the same MARKET SQUARE, still burning, people still screaming but everything is heightened. He can see the DEMONS twisting and sliding within the bodies of the Raiders like foul parasitic creatures feeding on the pain and fear. The VILLAGERS are screaming and twisted in tortured agony. Demons tear at them as their town burns. Dante could not have imagined anything worse. Only now does Kane start to SCREAM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEREDITH looks up from her stupor as they pass the entran to the town. The billowing smoke from the burning buildings smothers their way in a thick pall and as they pass through the broken walls of the market town are revealed. And in the town square are FIVE CRUCIFIED MEN. She cannot help but look at the horrific image and sees.. ...KANE ON THE CROSS. She hears his screams.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Solomon! Solomon! She screams now and tears at the bonds. Rocking the whole cage. A Raider smacks the cage with his cudgel. The prisoners shrink back in fear.

dialogues.speaker: RAIDER
dialogues.text: Silence! But Meredith ignores him, growing more hysterical with every moment.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER RAIDER
dialogues.text: (to the drivers) Get us away from here! The horses are whipped and the train picks up speed. Clattering away and increasing pace.  81 82 83 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 87

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Kane! ! SOLOMON KANE!!! Please! Kane!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE is still staring down at the vision before. Then he hears Meredith’s cries, faintly at first as if they are simply another part of his dying moments but then cutting through more clearly.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH 0/S
dialogues.text: Solomon! Solomon Kane! Please...God save him.... Beyond his vision of hell he can see MEREDITH’S WAGON outside the town gates.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: (barely a whisper) Meredith. She is alive. He has not yet failed.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Solomon!

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Meredith!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEREDITH is screaming and fighting as the wagon train mov away from the village. Slowly she is losing sight of Kane but doing everything she can to retain sight until the la possible moment, even as the Raiders are screaming at her for silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE watches as Meredith’s wagon thunders out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Meredith! No!! Kane closes his eyes, grits his teeth and summons every last drop of strength he has...  84 85 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 88 ...And with quivering muscles he begins to TEAR ONE ARM FROM THE CROSS. He pulls his wrist forwards, the NAIL SLIDING THROUGH HIS FLESH. He screams in soul shattering agony... The RAIDERS below him stand, frozen... unable to comprehe what is happening. And as he screams Kane let’s his weight drop against the rope holding him up and TEARS HIS OTHER ARM FREE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEREDITH still trying to see Kane and the village, finall loses sight of them. She slumps against her own bonds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE has dropped to the ground now. He is stunned and bleeding, trying to gain his breath and work through the agony. A few of the Raiders have stopped, amazed, to watch him a he struggles to a kneeling position, blood pouring from h wounds. Kane stares at them with cold fury. But he can se more than just the Raiders - he can see within the more corrupted Raiders, there are DEMONIC CREATURES, like a parasite writhing within its host. Evil eyes stare at him from behind the human masks. Summoning incredible willpower, Kane, picks up an abandon sword and readies for a fight. Instead the RAIDERS TURN AND FLEE.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: (shouting after them) Tell your Master I am coming! Tell him I will wipe him and his servants from this earth. The Raiders who are running from Kane head towards the to gates... Then, just as they pass through the entrance they are SUDDENLY ATTACKED by a HANDFUL OF MEN who appear from behind the town walls. The Raiders hardly have time to defend themselves and are BRUTALLY CUT DOWN. Exhausted, Kane barely notices as these rebel fighters approach him. At their head is the young man from the bar TELFORD.  86 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 89 Telford hurries towards Kane even as Kane begins to falte and drop back down to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rising up from his darkness he hears the VOICE first. An old woman’s voice, incanting in an ancient tongue. Maybe Celtic maybe older even than that

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN 0/S
dialogues.text: (in Celtic) A elfyntodd dwyr sinddyn duw cerrig yr fferllurig nwyn; os syriaeth ech saffaer tu fewr echlyn mor, necrombor llun KANE slowly opens his eyes to see - by the light of a flickering fire - an ANCIENT CRONE peering down at him an anointing him with liniments.

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD 0/S
dialogues.text: (hushed whisper ) He was a murderer, I know, but don’t we need someone like him?

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER VOICE 0/S
dialogues.text: You said he killed his own brother. Huge SHADOWS of other people flicker against the ceiling the CAVE he is in. The whole place is lit by fires and burning brands.

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD 0/S
dialogues.text: I do not know that. It was just a rumor aboard the ship. Beyond the old woman stands TELFORD and a DOZEN OF HIS COMRADES. All serious looking men. Exhausted, battle wear soldiers, talking quietly.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: (to the Crone) Keep your pagan magic away from me. The wounds on Kane’s wrists and feet have been bound with leaves and healing pastes.

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: (to Kane) My pagan magic is more ancient than your Christian god.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 90

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: It is evil, witch.

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: Not all witches are evil. And there are those who name you evil Kane. You who have one foot in the realm of the dead now. Did you cross over? What did you see? He doesn’t reply.

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: Your eyes see into the shadows now.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: What riddles do you speak?

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: You can see the demons that walk amongst us. Are within us. A gift and a curse.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Get away from me. She slowly rises to her feet and shuffles away from him.

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: You will meet your brother again soon enough, Solomon Kane.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: What do you know of my brother?

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: Is that not what you desire? To pay for you sins? She passes Telford as he approaches.

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: (to Telford) I have done what you asked; he will be well now.

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: What do you see of our future?

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: He will lead you into blood and darkness; are you ready for that?  87 88 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett on She pulls his hand away from her and continues into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entrance to THE CAVE is well hidden against a wooded hillside. Heavy rain and mist make it even harder to discern amongst the leaves and undergrowth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE climbs to his feet, ignoring TELFORD and the OTHERS. He stumbles a little in the half light but starts gatheri up some supplies and weapons.

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: What are you doing? A young fighter CALDICOTT - not much older than Samuel wa tries to help him but Kane shrugs his aid away.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Leaving.

dialogues.speaker: CALDICOTT
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: You are barely healed and there are too few of us just yet. As Kane reaches for swords and pistols, Telford stops him Kane grabs Telford and pins him up against the cave wall. blade on his throat in a flash. Everyone tenses. Swords grabbed, people press in - unsure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I do not ask you to come with me. I do not want you to. A great brute of a man, MCNESS, speaks.

dialogues.speaker: MCNESS
dialogues.text: Aye, but we will. We’re here to fight with you. Telford has promised us you will destroy this evil. Kane looks at Telford.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 92

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: That’s why you’re here; to kill Malachi?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: Then we can help you. Lead you to him. Help you find her. After a long pause Kane lowers his blade and relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kane now sits with the others chewing on some bread.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Tell me what you know of this Malachi.

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: From his castle overlooking Axmouth he is...

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Axmouth Castle? Kane is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Aye Axmouth; it’s a foul, place. Do you know it?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Axmouth Castle was... my home. I have not seen it for many years but I... (almost to himself) Have I come so far simply to...simply to return home?

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: It may have been your home but you can be sure it will not be like any home you remember. The village is naught but a ghost town, abandoned to the darkness. The land all about is frozen and dead.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: How did this happen?  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 93

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: Malachi opened a doorway to the underworld. Fed with the blood of his victims he draws forth every evil thing to corrupt the land.

dialogues.speaker: CALDICOTT
dialogues.text: They say he sold his soul.

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: He’s in league with a great evil now and builds an army to carry him to power. The demons he brings from hell use the bodies of the raiders.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I have seen them; coiled inside the soldiers like maggots in flesh. There is a sudden DISTURBANCE by the entrance to the cave Everyone reaches for their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE 0/S
dialogues.text: Hail friends. Put down your arms.

dialogues.speaker: MCNESS
dialogues.text: Merton. Harris. Smith; how fares it?

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: What news brothers? THREE MEN are entering. Shaking rain from their long coat handing over weapons and talking with their comrades in l voices. The leader of these new arrivals, MERTON, comes into the circle of firelight.

dialogues.speaker: MERTON
dialogues.text: We followed that last slave wagon the borders of Axmouth. I’m certain we can get through; there are so few guards now. His arrogance is such that he fears no attack. I... Kane stares at Merton who sees this and offers his hand i greeting.

dialogues.speaker: MERTON
dialogues.text: Captain Kane, I’m glad to see you well again; I’m Jack Merton.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 94 But WHAT KANE SEES is something beyond the human figure o Merton; he sees a shifting, shadowy creature within the human skin, peering out with fiery red eyes. Holding his gaze steadily Kane rises and takes Merton’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: MERTON
dialogues.text: What’s wrong? Then, without a word, Kane suddenly YANKS MERTON TOWARDS HIM, draws a pistol from his belt and FIRES INTO HIS CHES The report of the gun is deafening and is followed by turmoil. Merton clutches his chest and sinks to his knees in agony. McNess grabs Kane and hauls him backwards, throwing him t the ground. Half a dozen swords are pointed at Kane’s throat as Merto dies where he fell.

dialogues.speaker: CALDICOTT
dialogues.text: What have you done?!

dialogues.speaker: OTHERS 0/S
dialogues.text: Kill him! Kill him now! Fearlessly Kane pushes the threatening swords to one side and rises to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: This man, Merton, he was possessed of Malachi’s evil.

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: He was our friend; our comrade.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Could you not see what was within him? He was one of them.

dialogues.speaker: MCNESS
dialogues.text: I fought alongside him. He is no traitor. Kane strides over to Merton’s body.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: He was a traitor to you. Kane tears Merton’s clothes open to reveal the SYMBOL OF THE RAIDERS BRANDED ONTO HIS FLESH. There is a stunned silence.  90 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 95

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Your friend died long ago but his flesh was being used. You could not have known.

dialogues.speaker: CALDICOTT
dialogues.text: How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I can see them. As clear as you are to me now, I can see the evil inside them.

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: All that we planned is known by our enemy.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Then we have lost. How can we fight this power? Kane surveys the men before him. Though they are fierce and determined, they are really little more than farmers and peasants. And now they are confused and nervous. But Kane alone is undaunted.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Gather your weapons.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: We are not ready.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Neither are they.

dialogues.speaker: MCNESS
dialogues.text: We are too few.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I have taken cities with fewer. Telford, tell them, you know it is true. Gather your weapons; we ride out now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavy, dark rain clouds hang low over the valley. There i no life here. The whole world seems trapped in the iron fist of mid-winter and permanent twilight. Freezing rain lashes down. In Kane’s memory this may once have been ric in life and joy but now it is a black, skeletal place.  91 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 96 In the crook of the valley a SMALL TOWN lies silent. And the distance, on a hill, is the grey, glowering form of AXMOUTH CASTLE. Brooding over the whole valley. Beyond the castle, the sea crashes restlessly in the harbour The only sign of life is a SMALL GROUP OF RAIDERS returni to the castle with a WAGON OF CAPTIVES. Tiny against the landscape, they pass a sentry post just outside the village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TwO of MALACHI’S RAIDERS, bundled up against the cold, stand guard by a low wall. They wave the approaching Raiders and their wagon full of captives through.

dialogues.speaker: SENTRY RAIDER
dialogues.text: Any trouble?

dialogues.speaker: WAGON LEADER
dialogues.text: There is no fight in these people.

dialogues.speaker: SENTRY RAIDER
dialogues.text: Do not be so certain of that. The sentry throws back his hood - it is KANE dressed as a Raider. He draws two pistols and shoots the leader of the wagon raiders. Instantly TELFORD, McCNESS, SMITH, FLETCHER, HARRIS, CALDICOTT and five others - BRADFORD, COOPER, HAWKSTONE, GILLIGAN and SOFTLEY - rise up from behind the low walls and undergrowth. With pistols flaring and swords swinging they engage the remaining FOUR WAGON RAIDERS. Quickly overwhelming them. McNess, preferring a CUDGEL to anything more subtle batte one to a screaming, bloody death before beginning to stri him of his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: MCNESS
dialogues.text: Do we really have to wear these? They stink. These men were little were animals.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: McNess is an animal already.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: They were like you once, remember.  92 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 97 As Kane surveys the dead the CAPTIVES IN THE CAGED WAGON begin to scream for help. Arms outstretched, begging for mercy. CALDICOTT hurries to unlock the cage. Kane slams the door closed again.

dialogues.speaker: CALDICOTT
dialogues.text: You won’t free them?

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: We must let them go.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: A party of Raiders returning without prisoners? We will arouse suspicion. (to the prisoners) You have suffered but find strength for just a little longer. We will put an end to this horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavy rain and thick mist make the going difficult as KAN and his MEN, dressed as a raiding party, slowly approach the ominous and intimidating entrance to the castle. Ther are SIX RAIDERS, as before - the others are now within th slave cage itself hiding silently amongst the other captives. KANE and TELFORD are taking the lead. Telford stares up a the imposing castle.

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: (whispering) Your childhood was here? That explains a great deal.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: It was different back then but never a very happy place, even when my father was Lord. So near to the castle entrance now. Too late to turn back as the DOZEN GUARDS by the PORTCULLIS GATE see them approaching.

dialogues.speaker: MCNESS
dialogues.text: We can take these easily.  93 94 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 98

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: We want is to get inside the gates, not start a battle outside which we cannot win. Keep your mouth shut and your head down. They approach, heads bent low, slave cage full of prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At an agonizing crawl, Kane and his comrades pass by the castle guards. These Raiders are different from the other less human, even more corrupt and misshapen. As Kane looks at them he sees the evil within, shining through their eyes. He can almost feel them staring back into his own soul. McNess and Fletcher have hands poised over their pistols. With every step Kane feels they’1l be discovered and attacked but they are not. The PORTCULLIS GATE IS RAISED without a question and they are allowed into the inner courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PORTCULLIS is lowered behind them with a rattle of CHAINS as they enter the DESERTED COURTYARD. A LONE GUARD waves their wagon over to the dark entrance the castle dungeons. It is eerily silent now apart from t rattle and slap of the horse and wagon on the cobblestone Kane looks around, the first time he’s been home for so Many years.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: (quietly, to himself) I remember it. My home.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Malachi’s lair is in the Great Hall.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: (indicating) It is that way, then. Suddenly KANE SEES A SMALL FIGURE looking down on them fr a balcony window. It is THE WITCH who slaughtered the village. She grins at him with her pointed, crooked teeth showing and then darts away.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 99

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: (seeing the Witch) Kane...

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I know. Ready? Kane draws his swords just as the courtyard is suddenly FILLED WITH GUARDS rushing towards them. Striding amongst them comes the OVERLORD carrying his hug broadsword with him. He lunges for SMITH and HAWKSTONE. They attack him but he is swift and deadly. Their blows a deflected with ease and both are cut down. The Overlord turns his attention to GILLIGAN and the yout CALDICOTT. KANE sees this and charges through the fray. As the Overlord sweeps down a killing blow on Caldicott Kane brings his two blades together to block it.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: (to Caldicott) Run; you cannot win this. The Overlord shoves Kane’s blades aside and returns with flurry of blows from his own weapon. He is incredibly swift, slashing at Kane’s arm and leg. Kane stumbles and slips to the ground, just rolling away from a killing blow to his head.

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: This way men! Telford leads his men into the castle itself, finding cov inside. The guards follow them. Kane and the Overlord close on each other again. Both are well matched but the Kane is being forced back with each step. Kane manages a slashing cut across the Rider’s body but i draws no blood and seems to make little difference to him Kane knows he is in trouble now and is looking around now trying to find a way out. He ducks a low blow and makes a dash for a low wall. He dives over and finds himself tumbling down some STONE STEPS leading to an OPEN DOORWAY

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 95 96 97 98 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 199

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE dashes through the open doorway, slamming and barrin the door behind him and then sprints down the narrow corridors. He’s looking around him, moving fast, trying t get his bearings after all these years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ducking down side entrances and other passageways until t sound of combat and pursuit are far behind. He stops for a moment and gains his breath. Then he HEARS A SOUND. Not combat; something else... something plaintif and desperate; the sound of prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: The dungeons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE, alone, peers out from the shadows and down a long low roofed hallway into the dungeons. He’s trying to remember where to go, making several false turns through doorways and down steps. The SUDDEN SOUND of running feet and shouted instructions force him to take a side route and scurry down some stair into the darker levels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOANS and CRIES of pain and anguish emanate from the tiny cells. Water runs down the walls mingling with effluent a other wastes. It is foul. Kane peers through each tiny doorway portal looking for Meredith.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Meredith? Suddenly a GUARD APPEARS FROM AROUND A CORNER. KANE is on him in an instant, blades flashing across his throat. Blo sprays a nearby wall. HE GRABS THE HEAVY KEYS from the dead man’s belt and begi to unlock the doors. The CAPTIVES inside cower away from this crazed and bloodied man who suddenly appears before them.  99 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 101

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: You are free! Run! Go! Go now. He opens every door he can, heedless of the noise now. Bu none of the prisoners are Meredith. He grabs one of them.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Where are the others? Is this all of you? Meredith?! He shoves the picture locket into the prisoner’s face.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Did you see here? Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: PRISONER
dialogues.text: I do not know Sir. Please. I do not know. Kane flings open all the doors he can find and then final comes to THE LAST CELL IN THE BLOCK. At first it appears dark and empty. He turns away, ready to move on but he hears a cough and notices a movement in the shadows. He steps into the cell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a WIZENED OLD MAN lying on a bed of filthy wet straw. Kane approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: You are free. Quickly; leave this place. The old man simply stares at him. His breath wheezing slowly from his open, ragged mouth. He hardly seems well enough to move.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: If you don’t want your last days to be spent here you must leave now, old man.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: I cannot leave.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Let me help you then. Despite his urgency Kane kneels to help him but realizes that HE IS CHAINED TO THE WALL.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Why are you chained here?  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 192

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: For my sins. I cannot leave.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I think, perhaps, I can break these chains. Kane draws a pistol.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: Even without these chains I would stay.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Dear God why?

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: It is my home.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Your home? This place is no one’s home.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: It was mine once. Kane suddenly stops and stares hard at the old man. He moves to see him from a better angle, to allow some light to fall on his face. Kane is incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Father? Now the old man regards Kane with the same astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: Solomon? The old man can hardly form words. His eyes fill with tears.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: I... I thought you lost to me forever. He reaches out a shaking hand to touch the face of his lo lost son.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: You were just a boy when... Kane begins to tear at the chains. Hauling on them with a his might but making no difference.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 193

dialogues.speaker: FATHER KANE
dialogues.text: You will never break these chains; they are forged from dark magic as much as metal.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Tell me then how can I free you?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER KANE
dialogues.text: You cannot free me. Do not try. Kane’s father coughs. His weak body wracked with spasms o pain. Kane cradles his father in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I have so much shame for what I did. I never meant for Marcus to fall...I never meant for him to die.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER KANE
dialogues.text: Die? He did not die Solomon. He survived.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Marcus lives? I spent all these thinking I had killed my own brother.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER KANE
dialogues.text: He has a life still; if you can call it life.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER KANE
dialogues.text: He was so badly injured by the fall but he did not die. Alive in a way; his body did not die but his mind, his soul, were lost and no surgeons or priests could help. And so... so... I brought the sorcerer here.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Malachi? You brought him?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER KANE
dialogues.text: I sought him out and he came with promises of power and healing. I offered him everything I had, just to bring Marcus back to me. I couldn’t lose both my sons. The old man takes a pause now. He hardly has the strength to continue.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 104 Kane can hear the noise outside growing. Fleeing prisoner and the shouts of guards. He knows time is running out.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER KANE
dialogues.text: And he did Solomon; Using his mirrors and magic, Malachi reached into the darkness and brought Marcus back. But he was changed; he had such darkness, such violence and power. He spoke using others possessing them, forcing them to his way. His face was so damaged by the fall; he hid himself behind his mask and served only the will of the sorcerer. For all these years we lived in fear of him and Malachi.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: That masked rider... he is... my brother?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER KANE
dialogues.text: Aye; That creature is Marcus or once was. I don’t believe there is anything of my son there now. It is a demon wearing the flesh of your brother, nothing more. Malachi used my son to open a way for his creatures to come through. Another coughing spasm takes the old man. When he recover he can hardly speak.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER KANE
dialogues.text: Now you must do one thing for me...

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Just ask it and it will be done.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER KANE
dialogues.text: End my life.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: What? No!

dialogues.speaker: FATHER KANE
dialogues.text: I invited the sorcerer in. While I’m alive that freedom holds. That is why I am kept thus. He will never let me die. Kill me and you may hope to drive him from this land.  100 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 105

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Father I...

dialogues.speaker: FATHER KANE
dialogues.text: Do it! We both have our sins to answer for. I am ready to answer for mine now. Kane draws his pistol. He is in a world of confusion and pain. The old man grabs Kane’s shaking hand and holds the pistol to his own temple.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER KANE
dialogues.text: Free Marcus from his slavery. They hold each other’s gaze for a moment and then Kane PULLS THE TRIGGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE strides down the wide stone corridor, undaunted and unafraid now. He knows where he is going. There are SEVERAL DEAD GUARDS lying on the floor behind him.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Brother!! BROTHER! ! Closed double doors to the GREAT HALL are at the end of t long hallway ahead of him. Then, off to one side down another long wide hallway, he HEARS FIGHTING. Looking down he sees TELFORD, MCNESS, FLETCHER and just t others fighting desperately against a horde of the guards They are bloodied and struggling; soon to be overwhelmed but fighting onwards. FLETCHER SCREAMS in agony as he is cut down by the hideously misshapen creatures that protect this place. Telford sees Kane at the other end of the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: Kane! For God’s sake, help us!

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Kane runs to help them. Both pistols firing he takes down two of the enemy and then engages with his two blades. The old Kane of speed and savagery is fully returned as h turns and thrusts.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 196

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Is this all of you?

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
