dialogues.text: Caldicott is alive perhaps, and Smith but the others...no Fast and lethal as he is, there are simply too many guard The survivors are driven back into the main corridor befo the doors to the Great Hall. Though they snarl and cackle they keep their distance, rightly nervous of him.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: My father is dead! I am the Lord of this castle now; you have no claim here! Behind him, the doors to the Great Hall swing slowly open THE OVERLORD stands silently, sword in hand. Even the misshapen guards fall silent. Kane turns.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: (quietly) Brother... (to Telford, urgently) Free any other captives, get them away from here. The girl from my locket, Meredith, find her, free her.

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: Kane...

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Do as I order!

dialogues.speaker: TELFORD
dialogues.text: What of you?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: You will not see me again; I have to pay for my sins. Telford, McNess and the two others make a sudden break through the guards who make no attempt to follow - all ey are on Kane and their Master.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I do know you brother. No reply from the silent figure.  101 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 197

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I know you can speak. Again I ask; do you know me brother? Then, suddenly, ALL THE GUARDS SPEAK AS ONE - with the voice of the MARCUS.

dialogues.speaker: GUARDS/MARCUS
dialogues.text: You are my enemy. Kane spins to confront them but they do not move. He turn back to Marcus and advances still. Though he seems almost nervous. His hand on the hilt of his sword shakes so slightly. The beads of sweat on his brow catch the torchlight from the walls and each step taking him ever nearer to his true fate.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I am not your enemy. The fiend who did this to you is our enemy. Without another word Kane’s brother steps back into the great hall and is swallowed by the shadows. Kane cautiously, follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE stands in the flickering firelight of the great hall Drapes cover the windows, but there is plenty of light fr the candles and burning brands that fill the space. Hanging from the walls and standing on plinths around the floors are LARGE BLACK MIRRORS. They all have elaborate etchings on the glass; writing in arcane languages and symbols. Very much like those on Kane’s own body. With his vision, he can see the demonic creatures writhin and twisting within their glass prisons. They are pressin up against the surface, clearly trapped but eager to be free. The DOORS SLAM CLOSED behind Kane. He is trapped. There is VAST FLAT STONE ALTAR LIKE A WHEEL in the centre of the hall where THE CLOAKED FIGURE OF A MAN is crouched over the BODIES tied down to the stone. The shadows seem be drawn to him, a darkness that clings and circles about him. There’s the GLINT of A KNIFE in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Malachi! ! The SORCERER turns to Kane. He speak with surpassing smoothness - his voice is velvet yet mocking, seductive a powerful.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 198

dialogues.speaker: MALACHI
dialogues.text: Welcome home Solomon. Do you like what I have done with the place?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: It will look better with your head on a spike over the gates. Malachi suddenly slips away from the altar and VANISHES INTO THE SHADOWS. Kane, swords ready, waits for a sudden attack but none comes. Nervously he approaches the altar. Channels have been cut into the stone to allow their bloo to flow into a DEEP WELL that seems to have somehow grown from the foundation stones. A pulsing sound, like a giant heartbeat, comes from within - along with the sounds of souls in tormented agony. The place is crusted with the blood of hundreds. Body parts and corpses are hanging fro the walls amongst demonic symbols and writings.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Dear god, how could this happen? Then he sees MOVEMENT ON THE ALTAR. A victim is still alive. He hurries to help them and sees... ...it is MEREDITH. She is barely conscious; battered and bloody. Her clothes are torn, her ankles and wrists tied down amongst the oth victims.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Thank God. Meredith? She opens her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: I prayed you would come for me.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I swore I would. He cuts one hand free and starts on the other when... ...he suddenly winces in PAIN as A SWORD BLADE pierces through his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Solomon! The blade is yanked out again roughly. Kane can hardly ge his breath through the pain as he turns and sees his BROTHER.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 199 ANOTHER DEADLY BLOW SWEEPS IN. Instinctively he raises hi own weapon and blocks the strike but it sends him reeling backwards. Meredith desperately unties her other bonds. MARCUS advances mercilessly as Kane limps away.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Marcus... listen; if you can hear me...Brother! You do not have to do this... Marcus attacks furiously, stabbing and slashing at Kane w defends himself and backs away.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Where is your master? Is he hiding in the shadows? (shouting out) Is this how you pay for your power? With the blood of innocents? Malachi’s voice echoes through the great hall.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHI 0/S
dialogues.text: All power is paid for with the blood of innocents. You know that better than any. The figure of MALACHI, the SORCERER, appears at the end o the hall. Swathed in dark cloth and drawing the shadows with him as he moves.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHI
dialogues.text: See who is here for you Kane. Malachi pulls back a huge cloth that covers a VAST BLACK MIRROR. Four times the height of a man, it too is etched the spells and symbols of the others. But it is what is waiting inside that takes Kane’s breath... A DEMON is there. Huge but trapped behind the magical surface of the mirror; it is like a trapped beast, pushin at the surface that bulges and ripples, barely holding ba its enormous power.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHI
dialogues.text: This demon will not fail to take your soul back to Hell. And just a little more blood Kane, and it will be free. Kane is frightened now. Desperate. He turns back to Marcu urgently.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 119

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Our father is dead! Malachi has no control here any more.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHI 0/S
dialogues.text: Remember Solomon, your brother is the heir. And I am his master. His brother closes on Kane again but now Kane draws his second sword and fights back with everything he has.

dialogues.speaker: ON MEREDITH
dialogues.text: MEREDITH HAS FREED HERSELF and scrambles away, watching i horror as events unfold.

dialogues.speaker: ON KANE
dialogues.text: Kane backing away from Marcus down a corridor of BLACK MIRRORS. He ducks beneath a devastating roundhouse sword swing that shatters a BLACK MIRROR, sending shards everywhere. The broken demon within screams as it vanishe

dialogues.speaker: MALACHI 0/S
dialogues.text: The mirrors! No!

dialogues.speaker: ON MEREDITH
dialogues.text: She stumbles to the doors of the hall. She pulls it open only to reveal the horde of GUARDS pressing in. The leade of the Guards hold the SEVERED HEADS of TELFORD, McNESS a the others before them. Meredith screams and retreats.

dialogues.speaker: ON KANE
dialogues.text: Marcus swings his massive sword back and forth at Kane wh ducks and steps back each time. And each time another mirror smashes, sending another demon back to hell. Then suddenly Kane thrusts hard with his own swords penetrating his brother’s flesh. But no blood comes out a the warrior shows no sign of his injury. Marcus grabs Kane and draws him close, into a deadly embrace. The life is slowly squeezed from him. Up close, Kane can hear his brother’s rattling breath and strange rasping sounds coming from behind the mask

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Forgive me for what I did to you. Kane struggles against the impossible strength of his brother, scrabbling at his armour and finally getting a hand to his mask...  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett aa

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I would see your face one last time brother. As he TEARS THE MASK AWAY Marcus HURLS Kane away. Kane falls to his knees but looks up at his brother horrified at what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: My god... It is clear that his brother is nothing more than an animated corpse. One side of his face is smashed in and h jaw is mostly torn away. A LIDLESS EYEBALL stares out fro a disfigured and distorted face. The flesh is white and bloodless with tears in the skin stitched and poorly repaired.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: (yelling to Malachi) What have you done to him?! (to Marcus) Brother please, let me kill this man who has cursed you. I will lay your soul to rest. Is there just a flicker of something human within Marcus. Slowly, lowers his sword and relaxes his fighting stance. But Malachi smothers it quickly.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHI
dialogues.text: Kill him slave! I command you. I order the demon within you; destroy him. Almost involuntarily Marcus begins to surge towards Kane again. As the ferocious sword blow sweeps down, Kane grabs a tal flaming torch and drives it into Marcus’s chest. With all his own weight behind it Marcus stops dead. The flaming brand burst on his clothing, igniting him in seconds. Soon MARCUS IS ENGULFED IN FIRE. BUT IT DOES NOT STOP HIM. The REAPER is pushing ever harder against his mirror pris walls. With every violent blow on the glass it bulges out more every time.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: She is backing away from the guards as they close in on her... right into MALACHI. He sweeps her into his cloaked arms...muffling her screams.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 112

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Solomon!

dialogues.speaker: MALACHI
dialogues.text: (to Meredith) Just a little more blood.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: But Kane sees this.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: No! Meredith! KANE is focused on Meredith but just in time he realises that Marcus is right behind him. His sword arcs down towards Kane who dodges out of the way. Kane paries more blows as the burning man presses towards him.

dialogues.speaker: ON MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Malachi is dragging Meredith towards the Reaper’s giant mirror. She’s struggling and fighting him hard.

dialogues.speaker: ON KANE
dialogues.text: Kane once again presses in on Marcus, relentlessly forcin him back towards the sacrificial table. The room is beginning to ignite now, drapes and fabric flare up. Tables and chairs catch as the two fight.

dialogues.speaker: ON MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Malachi finally overpowers Meredith. He takes her arm and slashes the flesh with his knife. Her blood splashes onto the Reaper’s mirror. Immediately begins to MELT THROUGH THE GLASS, creating an opening. Th BEAST BEGINS TO SLOWLY TEAR OPEN the rent in the glass.

dialogues.speaker: ON KANE
dialogues.text: Kane now presses hard on the weakening Marcus. He’s cutti and slicing at him and smashing each and every mirror the pass. The howls of the demons fading within. Kane sees the Reaper tearing through the glass. The SOUND of it like a SHRIEKING WIND filling the hall. The flames all around being sucked towards it like a vacuum. Finally Marcus sinks to his knees. Through the fire that burns him, stares at Kane. Marcus speaks in his faint, we voice.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 113

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Kill me Solomon; End my torture. I beg you. Kane draws his strength together and finally sees somethi akin to recognition in his brother’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Rest in peace brother. KANE SLICES MARCUS’S HEAD FROM HIS SHOULDERS. The DEMON that possessed his body SQUIRMS OUT OF THE RAGGED HOLE IN HIS NECK. Kane can see it clearly.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: These eyes of mine see you for what you are. He stabs the demon and it dies, screeching, beneath his twisting blade.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHI
dialogues.text: No! INSTANTLY ALL THE GUARDS AND RAIDERS BEGIN TO FALTER and collapse as the demonic power that drives them fades. Kane charges forward to confront Malachi now. Behind him the Reaper in the mirror is beginning to enter this world Malachi pulls Meredith to him, knife to her throat. Kane stops dead.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHI
dialogues.text: This is how the boy died. I saw that through your brother’s eyes. You begged for his life but did nothing.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I will not let it happen again.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHI
dialogues.text: You have no choice. Your soul is forfeit. I called Him here to claim you.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Let her go.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHI
dialogues.text: I think, just one more drop of blood will do it.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Stop.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett a4 Kane lowers his swords to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Kill him Solomon.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Let her go.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHT
dialogues.text: Why do you care for her? You came here to save your soul.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: She is my soul. Kane whips out the FLINTLOCK PISTOL that has been tucked into his belt, levels it at Malachi and fires. The bullets hits him square between the eyes, SPLATTERING blood and gore onto the mirror. Meredith twists round and violently shoves Malachi backwards and he falls INTO THE GLASS, tumbling backwards in the black void. Instantly the REAPER is utterly free to step through into this realm. Its cloven foot steps through the glass and crashes onto the stone castle floor. The shrieking wind rises in tone. Kane dashes forward and pulls Meredith to safety, backing away from the DEMON as it pulls itself into their world a draws itself fully upright before them. They stand, rooted to the spot. Meredith, terrified but Kane fearless and unwavering before it

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Dear God, what will we do, Solomon?! Please! We must run!

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: No. Wait. Trust me. And even as the terrifying, predatory face of the Reaper glares down at them, a thousand cracks begin to appear on it. Seconds later the DEMON SHATTERS, its myriad pieces are sucked back into the black mirror surface and then th too, folds and bends back in on itself until it fades toa singularity and then vanishes. Nothing but the ornate fra remains. The shrieking wind fades to an echo in the great hall as Kane folds Meredith into his arms. Finally she looks up a him.  102 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 11s

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Your father; told me that if I saved you my soul would be redeemed. I believed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KANE, his wounds bandaged and his clothes repaired, bows his head in prayer as he kneels before TwO FRESH GRAVES o the windswept cliff top overlooking the endless expanse o ocean. The last resting place of his Father and Brother Finally he stands and reaches for the TRAVEL BAGS that ar nearby. A horse, ready for travel, is grazing calmly nearby. Behind the him the CASTLE that was his home dominates the horizon. A figure is racing towards him.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Solomon! He turns to her and waits silently as she approaches.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Solomon, where are you going? I don’t understand why you’re leaving.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: But you won; you defeated them. (still nothing from him) This is your home.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: It was once.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: It can be again. We can make it a home together. Kane looks down the cliff to the sea and the jagged rocks below.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: This is where my brother fell. (a beat) What I did to Marcus here, began this journey.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 116

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Your journey is over Solomon.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: It’s not over. Not yet. (a beat) All my travels, the things I’ve seen, the things I’ve done... through this I have found my purpose. I know why I am here. She doesn’t understand. She doesn’t want to. Kane comes close to her now.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: There are evil creatures walking this earth, Meredith. They bring such pain and suffering and there was never a man who could fight them. But I can. I can. It is my gift and I will hunt them down and send each and every one back to hell. Kane looks down at Meredith. For a brief moment there is longing in his eyes, she sees this and moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH
dialogues.text: Please don’t go. Gently he pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I have to. One day I promise I’1l come home again but not until my work is done. He turns from her and slings his bags onto the horse. His swords and brace of pistols are visible now as he pulls himself up onto the saddle. Without looking back he rides away. Meredith watches for a long time, until Kane is lost against the darkening horizon. FADE TO BLACK. CREDITS ROLL.
